revised_title: Observations of Two Notable Meteors in 1783
tldr: The author, Alexander Aubert, describes his observations of two meteor events that occurred in August and October of 1783. He provides detailed accounts of the appearance, size, and movement of the meteors, as well as their impact on the surrounding environment. The first meteor was a large, luminous body that moved in a curved path and left behind several smaller globules, while the second meteor was a red, oblong body that illuminated the surrounding area.
